"THINK TANK"
is an idea which could be developed into a pro¬
gram series for the gifted teen-ager. This could
be a series of programs through which these young
people could be challenged by creative, original
thinkers from the community. Group-oriented, such
a series could interface these youth with such
people as Dr. Alan Nevins, of the Huntington Library,
in California, Dr. Henry Steele Comager, of Amherst,
Robert M. Hutchins, of the Center For The Study Of
Democratic Institutions, in Santa Barbara, California,
Mr. J. V. Vaughan, Director of the Peace Corps, Am¬
bassador Arthur Goldberg, Chief U. S. Delegate to the
United Nations. That is one level of dialogue.
Another could be structured on the local community
level, with these youth exchanging views with com¬
munity leadership, examining a wide spectrum of prob¬
lems which affect youth directly.
The concept of a program idea like this is projected
by providing youth the opportunity to challenge the
status quo of our institutions and of our social order.
Our gifted youth must, in some way, be shown that
there does exist a high level of concern about them.
